critique: This document pertains to the regulation of the distilled spirits industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933. It approves an amendment to the Code of Fair Competition for the Distilled Spirits Rectifying Industry. Given the context of the New Deal era, this suggests government intervention in the economy. There is no information related to immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, or social inclusion. The document seems ideologically neutral, focusing on economic regulation within a specific industry.
